definition: France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])

sentences.english: He was found guilty by the court-martial and sentenced to imprisonment.
sentences.chinese: 軍事法庭判他有罪並判他坐牢。
他甚至可能接受軍事法庭審訊。
我觀察了軍事法庭的審判。

sentences.english: Or you may initiate a letter of appeal and request a trial by court-martial .
sentences.chinese: 或者你可以寫一封信向軍事法庭提出上訴。

sentences.english: The military tribunals in Guantánamo have evoked little public interest.
sentences.chinese: 關塔那摩的軍事法庭很少引起公衆的關注。

sentences.english: And you? What happened at your court-martial?
sentences.chinese: 倒是你，軍事法庭那邊怎麼樣了？

sentences.english: Those convicted in military courts should be held in military prisons.
sentences.chinese: 那些被軍事法庭判刑的人應該被關押在軍事監獄。

sentences.english: Why does Vere convene a court-martial aboard ship?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼爲耳在船上召開一個軍事法庭？

definition: to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
Chen Jiongming (1878-1933), a leading warlord of Guangdong faction, defeated in 1925 and fled to Hong Kong
the Kempeitai or Japanese Military Police 1881-1945 (Japanese counterpart of the Gestapo during WWII)
United Front (either of the two alliances between the Guomindang and the Communist Party, 1923-1927 and 1937-1945)
Japanese Kwantung army (or Kantō army), notorious for numerous atrocities in China during WWII
